intro: Phyteuma occidentale, commonly known as western phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and prefers full sun. Its blooming period occurs in the summer months, producing clusters of violet or blue flowers. It is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
